content.description:
Who hasn't walked past this clean, striking arete? The Product is remarkable in many regards. It and its neighboring route seem to have take all of the solid rock in the area and combined it into two bullet hard features.

 From afar, The Product looks perfect, but up close, you can see its namesake; glue. The beginning is covered in it, but don't let that distract you. The next 16 bolts feature a wide variety of delicate face climbing, bewildering arete movement, and creative resting zones. The crescendo is a powerful left to right sequence across the obvious finishing crack system.Â
content.location: Left arete of the Juniper Spire.

content.description: This solitary spire sits alone among a sea of terrible rock. Features two prominent arete routes. Both visible from the Northern Point and trail to the canal.(It should be noted that this spire is not part of the Monument area and does not have any seasonal bird closures.)
